meanings.definition: To pay someone for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The company is remunerating the employees for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: She is remunerating the plumber for fixing the leak.
meanings.sent3: The magician remunerated the rabbit for its tricks with a carrot.
meanings.sent4: The sun remunerates the flowers with warmth and light.
meanings.sent5: Remunerating the babysitter ensures she will come back next time.

meanings.definition: To compensate someone for their work.
meanings.sent1: The boss is remunerating the team for their successful project.
meanings.sent2: They are remunerating the artist for painting the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain remunerated his crew with a share of the treasure.
meanings.sent4: Kindness remunerates itself by bringing joy to others.
meanings.sent5: Remunerating the gardener motivates him to tend the plants diligently.

meanings.definition: Providing payment or compensation for a service.
meanings.sent1: The remunerating client was satisfied with the quality of work.
meanings.sent2: She received a remunerating offer for her freelance services.
meanings.sent3: The remunerating customer left a generous tip for the waiter.
meanings.sent4: A smile can be a remunerating gesture for good service.
meanings.sent5: The remunerating contract ensured fair payment for the job.
